stages.logText: A huge rat called Gruiik told me that they drove all the people out of this village.
Some two-legs were running around in the garden again. I should kill them.
I have killed Mara.
I have killed Tharal.
I told Gruiik that I have killed Mara and Tharal.
I lied to Gruiik that I have killed Mara and Tharal.
Gruiik was hungry and asked to bring him bread.
I found a bread in a bag hanging at the door of the Crossglen town hall.
I gave a bread to Gruiik.
The huge rat ignored me after he had got the bread.
I woke up when I felt that something had bitten my toe. Apparently I had a nightmare - there were rats everywhere! Anyway, I wasn't even slightly recovered.
An ancient meditating man rewarded me with a rat skull for a wise discussion.
I took a leg bone of a rat from a gold hunter.
I stole a leg bone of a rat from the instrument maker.
In the center of a labyrinth I found a leg bone of a rat.
I took a leg bone of a rat from the dancing but vengeful and unforgiving skeletons.
I found the tail bones of a dead rat on a platform in a lake.
In a library I found the back bone of a big rat.
I got some rib bones of a rat from the skeleton leader.
A small, naughty rat called Clevred claimed that he could help me get out of here. In return, he required of me to help to find a yellow, round artifact.
I should look around in the rat cave. Clevred probably meant the Crossglen's supply cave.
In the depth of the supply cave I found a new statue, that resembles to my brother Andor.
The rats had erected the statue in honor of Andor for never killing rats. I should begin your search behind this statue.
I would need a pickaxe to tear down the statue.
Audir, the smith of Crossglen, sold me an old, sturdy pickaxe.
I tore down the statue of Andor. Behind it in the wall I found a hole in the shape of a bone.
I have put a bone into the hole, and the wall crumbled to dust.
A torch could help to see in the dark. Unfortunately, the torch is so heavy, that I would have to lift it with both hands.
I found a platform with a good view over Crossglen. Andor seemed to have been here many times.
I found Andor's hideout.

I found an exit from the caves to the surface. Cold icy wind was swirling up here on the Black Water mountain top. 
Astonishingly I wasn't alone here - Whootibarfag, a very old hermit seemed to have been waiting for me.
Whootibarfag was delighted with my help in rescuing Rat King Rah's skeleton. As a thank you, he let me in on the secret of the rat escape. This increased my ability to flee.
Wart, the warden to the halls of memory told me, that the access would be closed, until the rat memorial is restored. I should seek the bones of King Rah's skeleton.
Wart told me that he needed the head, the ribs and the back bone, 4 legs and the tail.
Wart said that I just have to find the skull.
Wart said that I just have to find the back bone.
Wart said that I have to find the rib bones.
Wart said that I just have to find the tail.
Wart said that I just have to find the fourth leg.
I donated King Rah's sword to the memory hall.
I sold King Rah's sword to the memory hall.
Wart was glad to have his rat memorial restored. He granted access to the memory hall now.
Wart told me that Fraedro was captured.
Wart allowed me to go deeper into the cave and have a word with Fraedro.
I believed in Fraedro's innocence and released him.
I attacked Fraedro to avenge the theft of King Rah.
I tried Fraedro's tiny golden key in a hole of the cavewall near to his prison. Immediatly the wall gave way to another passage.
I finally found the yellow artifact: It was a big round and smelly cheese! Golden yellow and so large that it would provide almost unlimited food. Clevred was overjoyed!
I told Clevred that I you couldn't help him further with the search. He then left me to search on his own.
Although I had told Clevred that I couldn't help him further with the search and he then left me, I met him in the caves again. I have decided to start the search again.
The big yellow cheese now weighs heavily in my bag. Small consolation for the loss of a friend, though.

I fought my way through the roundlings. But Clevred was seriously wounded in the fight. He was just able to give me his beloved artifact. 
With a last breath he thanked me for my company and died in my arms.
I persuaded Clevred to leave the artifact behind. Clevred obeyed disappointedly, but he left me on the spot.
I fell asleep just in front of my bed. After long hours of deep and dreamless sleep I woke up - all the rats were gone! Was it only a dream?

Roskelt, the leader of a gang of skeletons, claimed to be king of the caves. He demanded that I would seek out his brother and bring him a message: if he came and surrendered, then he would have the grace of a quick, almost painless death.

Bloskelt, the leader of a gang of skeletons, claimed to be king of the caves. He demanded that I would seek out his brother and bring him a message: if he came and surrendered, then he would have the grace of a quick, almost painless death.
Bloskelt, a leader of another gang of skeletons, also had claimed to be king of the caves. I delivered Roskelt's message, but earned nothing but laughter.
Roskelt, a leader of another gang of skeletons, also had claimed to be king of the caves. I delivered Bloskelt's message, but earned nothing but laughter.
Roskelt asked me to kill his brother.
Bloskelt asked me to kill his brother.
I have killed Bloskelt.
I have killed Roskelt.
For all my efforts, I've got a pretty poor reward.
